newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Telecel likely to be listed Lisbon Dec 10-sources.
newsitem.headline: Telecel likely to be listed Lisbon Dec 10-sources.

text.p: Shares in Portuguese mobile phone company Telecel are likely to be listed on Lisbon bourse on December 10, market sources said.
"Everything indicates that the operation (Public Offer to Sell) will take place on December 9 and that the shares will be admitted to Lisbon bourse on December 10," one source said.
Telecel will also be listed on New York stock exchange.
Market sources said the road show to promote the sale had been set for November 22 to December 6. The first week of the road show will be in Europe and the second in the United States.

The price of the operation will be defined after a process of bookbuilding. The placing of the shares will be aimed at international and Portuguese institutional investors and the Portuguese general public.
The number of shares to be sold has yet to be defined.
Telecel is estimated to be worth between 130 and 160 billion escudos, market sources said.
Telecel has a capital of 21.5 billion escudos.
The main shareholder in Telecel is Telepri, a holding held jointly by the Espirito Santo and Amorim groups. Telepri now has a 75 percent stake in Telecel.
Banco Essi, Lehman Brothers and SBC Warburg were chosen as the global coordinators of the operation, market sources said.
